Legal_Issue: Whether the trademark 'LIGHTRECYCLE & DESIGN' is clearly descriptive under s. 12(1)(b) of the Trade-marks Act
Evidence_Assessment: New evidence was considered during the appeal process
Legal_Rule: A trademark is not registrable if it is clearly descriptive of the goods or services associated with its use
Procedural_Issue: Consideration of new evidence on appeal
Grounds_for_Claim: Trademark is not clearly descriptive due to multiple interpretations of 'light' and significance of design element
Decision_Maker: Registrar of Trademarks and reviewing court
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Court upheld rejection but found Registrar's reasoning unreasonable
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Appeal process allowed consideration of new evidence
Key_Evidence_Considered: Meaning and interpretation of 'light', role of 'DESIGN' in the mark, nature of recycling services offered
Applicant_Challenge: Product Care Association challenged Registrar's refusal
Defendant_Response: Registrar maintained that the mark was clearly descriptive
Evidence_Type: Interpretive linguistic analysis, service description, trademark design
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Mark is clearly descriptive of recycling services for light-related products
Applicable_Process: Administrative appeal followed by judicial review
